title: Swift Response to Measles Outbreak in Sukkur
content:
PHRO swiftly responded to a measles outbreak in Taluka New Sukkur, UC Rahooja/Lal Mashaiq, where four children tragically lost their lives. Within days, PHRO coordinated with the District Commissioner and District Health Office to establish a medical camp, vaccinating 150 children and screening 400.

Key actions included dispelling harmful myths (e.g., hanging onions to ward off measles), conducting awareness sessions, and mobilizing DHO teams. The intervention prevented further fatalities and strengthened community trust in vaccination.

Results:

  • 150 children vaccinated
  • 400+ screened
  • 5 deaths halted post-intervention

title: Flood Relief for 140,840 People in Sindh
content:
During the 2022 floods, PHRO provided critical aid to 140,840 individuals across Sukkur, Khairpur, and Ghotki districts. The organization distributed 2,500 ration bags, set up 20 mobile health clinics serving 25,250 patients, and delivered winterization kits to 500 families.

Collaborating with IOM, USAID, and local authorities, PHRO ensured access to food, medical care, and shelter for displaced communities, including persons with disabilities and marginalized groups.

Results:

  • 140,840 beneficiaries
  • 20 mobile health camps
  • 2,500+ ration bags distributed

title: Women's CNIC Registration Drive
content:
PHRO partnered with NADRA to register 818 women for CNICs in UC Garhi Mori, empowering them to access government services, vote, and assert their legal rights. The campaign targeted marginalized groups, including religious minorities and persons with disabilities.

Through door-to-door outreach and mobile registration vans, PHRO addressed systemic barriers to documentation, enabling women to participate fully in civic life.

Results:

  • 818 women registered
  • 100% target achieved
  • Increased voter participation

title: Combating Gender-Based Violence Through Awareness
content:
PHRO conducted 16 Days of Activism campaigns in Sukkur and Ghotki, educating communities on GBV prevention and legal rights. Sessions reached 2,000+ participants, including men, women, and religious leaders, with puppet shows and legal aid workshops.

The initiative linked survivors to protection services and challenged harmful norms like honor killings and child marriage, resulting in a 40% increase in reported cases to authorities.

Results:

  • 2,000+ participants engaged
  • 40% rise in GBV reporting
  • 10+ referral pathways established

title: Puppet Shows for Child Abuse Prevention
content:
PHRO collaborated with Sahil Organization to deliver interactive puppet shows in Sukkur schools, teaching 1,200+ children to recognize and report abuse. The program emphasized safety rules like 'No secrets from parents' and 'Say no to uncomfortable touches.'

Post-intervention surveys showed 85% of children could identify unsafe situations, and teachers reported increased disclosures of abuse.

Results:

  • 1,200+ children educated
  • 85% knowledge retention
  • 20+ abuse cases reported
